passage_text: Sicily is Italy's largest island and the largest island in the Mediterranean Sea. It's also a geographical and political region of Italy, famed for its beautiful beaches, cuisine, and fascinating history.
1 Airports on the Island of Sicily Sicily is one of the autonomous regions in Italy and the largest island in the Mediterranean Sea.

Sicily has a roughly triangular shape, which earned it the name Trinacria. To the east, it is separated from the Italian region of Calabria by the Strait of Messina, about 3 km (1.9 mi) wide in the north, and about 16 km (9.9 mi) in the southern part.

Share to: 1  Airports on the Island of Sicily Sicily is one of the autonomous regions in Italy and the largest island in the Mediterranean Sea. 2  Rocky coasts opening up to the emerald sea, delicious cuisine, exquisite win….
Sicily is an autonomous region of Italy. It is an island of southern Italy in the Mediterranean Sea west of the southern end of the Italian peninsula.

It is separated from the mainland of Italy by the Strait of Messina. At their closest points, Sicily and Italy are separated by just 2 miles (3 km) in the northern part of the strait, while in the southern part the distance between the two is 10 miles (16 km).

1 The capital of Sicily is Palermo. 2  Sicily is the largest island in the Mediterranean Sea. 3  Sicily is one of the five autonomous regions of Italy. 4  Sicily’s Mount Etna is Europe’s tallest active volcano, and one of the most active in the world.

Sicily [1] (Sicilia) is a rugged and attractive island on the southern tip of Italy, and is one of the country's 20 regions. It is separated from the mainland region of Calabria by the 5 km Straits of Messina.
